Obsidian-Compatible Markdown Features Guide

person
Apoorv Katiyar
‚Ä¢ calendar_today Sun Dec 01 2024 00:00:00 GMT+0000 (Coordinated Universal Time) ‚Ä¢ schedule 6 min read
Markdown Obsidian Features

This portfolio now supports advanced Obsidian-like markdown features! Here's a comprehensive guide to what you can use.

üìù Callouts (Admonitions)

Obsidian-style callouts are fully supported:

[!NOTE]
This is a note callout. Use it for general information.

[!TIP]
This is a tip callout. Use it for helpful suggestions.

[!WARNING]
This is a warning callout. Use it to alert readers.

[!IMPORTANT]
This is for important information that shouldn't be missed.

[!CAUTION]
This is for cautionary information about risks.

üîó Wiki-Style Links

Reference other blog posts using Obsidian-style wiki links:

  • Link to post: terraform-vs-cloudformation
  • Link with date: cicd-pipelines-best-practices

These automatically convert to clickable links within your blog!

üìê Math Equations

Write mathematical expressions using KaTeX:

Block Math

E=mc2
i=1‚àën‚Äãi=2n(n+1)‚Äã

Inline Math

The quadratic formula is x=2a‚àíb¬±b2‚àí4ac‚Äã‚Äã and it's very useful.

üìä Mermaid Diagrams

Create beautiful diagrams using Mermaid syntax:

graph LR
    A[Start] --> B[Process]
    B --> C{Decision}
    C -->|Yes| D[Success]
    C -->|No| E[Error]
    D --> F[End]
    E --> F

Flowchart Example

flowchart TD
    A[Markdown File] -->|Front Matter| B[Metadata]
    A -->|Content| C[Processing]
    C -->|Math| D[KaTeX]
    C -->|Diagrams| E[Mermaid]
    C -->|Links| F[Wiki Convert]
    D --> G[HTML Output]
    E --> G
    F --> G

Sequence Diagram

sequenceDiagram
    participant Client
    participant Server
    participant Database
    
    Client->>Server: Request
    Server->>Database: Query
    Database->>Server: Result
    Server->>Client: Response

üìö Footnotes

Add footnotes to your content1 and reference them later2.

üìã Task Lists

Track your tasks with checkboxes:

  • Completed task
  • Pending task
  • Another completed task
  • Work in progress

üìä Tables

Create structured data with tables:

Feature Supported Notes
Callouts ‚úÖ All 5 types supported
Wiki Links ‚úÖ Automatic conversion
Math ‚úÖ KaTeX rendering
Diagrams ‚úÖ Mermaid support
Footnotes ‚úÖ Full support
Task Lists ‚úÖ Interactive checkboxes

üíª Code Syntax Highlighting

Code blocks with multiple language support:

def fibonacci(n):
    if n <= 1:
        return n
    return fibonacci(n-1) + fibonacci(n-2)
const greet = (name) => {
    return `Hello, ${name}!`;
};

console.log(greet('World'));
#!/bin/bash
echo "Building the project..."
npm run build
echo "Build complete!"

üé® Text Formatting

You can use various text formatting options:

  • Bold text for emphasis
  • Italic text for nuance
  • Bold italic text for strong emphasis
  • Strikethrough text for removed content
  • inline code for commands
  • ==Highlighted text== for important points

üìå Blockquotes

Standard blockquotes are also enhanced:

"The only way to do great work is to love what you do." ‚Äî Steve Jobs

This is a regular blockquote that looks great and is easy to read in the blog format.

üîú Coming Soon

We're constantly improving! Future enhancements may include:

  • Embed support
  • Link previews on hover
  • Backlink references
  • Graph visualization
  • Transclusion

Happy writing! You now have a powerful Obsidian-compatible markdown blog. Start creating amazing content! üöÄ
